messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] water "play"
messages.msgSnippet: ... I think here your choice of words was inappropriate. He KNOWS he CAN. I probably would have used NO! here. With a very quick explanation of why not---and
messages.messageBody:
> >
>
> Exactly, to him it was great FUN, a wonderful topping to a wonderful day...
>
> I'm glad I was able to see his joy in it at the time, while mortified for
> the
> neighbor, I knew he wasn't trying to be nasty, just impulsive, and little
> boys (and sometimes big ones) are entitled to those adventures sometimes

I think here your choice of words was inappropriate. He KNOWS he CAN. I
probably would have used NO! here. With a very quick explanation of why
not---and maybe let him spray ME! <G>

~Kelly
I have to agree. I don't think it was appropriate to let him enjoy that adventure at the neighbor's expense.

Kristen

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] water "play"
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/11/2003 12:29:27 PM Eastern Daylight Time, ... Exactly, to him it was great FUN, a wonderful topping to a wonderful day... I m glad I was
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/11/2003 12:29:27 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
kbcdlovejo@... writes:

> Yeah. My first thought was, "Sure, I can---just watch me!" <g>
>

Exactly, to him it was great FUN, a wonderful topping to a wonderful day...
I'm glad I was able to see his joy in it at the time, while mortified for the
neighbor, I knew he wasn't trying to be nasty, just impulsive, and little
boys (and sometimes big ones) are entitled to those adventures sometimes.
